CHAPTER 10: VEHICLES AND TRAFFIC
MOTOR VEHICLES AND TRAFFIC
10.01 PROVISIONS OF STATE LAWS ADOPTED BY REFERENCE
A. State Traffic Laws Adopted
Except as otherwise specifically provided in this Chapter, the statutory
provisions in Chapters 340 to 348 of the Wisconsin Statutes, describing and
defining regulations with respect to vehicles and traffic, exclusive of any
provisions therein relating to penalties to be imposed and exclusive of any
regulations for which the statutory penalty is a fine or term of
imprisonment, are hereby adopted and by reference made a part of this
Code as if fully set forth herein. Any act required to be performed or
prohibited by any statute incorporated herein by reference is required to be
performed or prohibited by this Chapter. Any future amendments, revisions,
or modifications of the statutes incorporated herein are intended to be made
a part of this Chapter in order to secure uniform statewide regulation of
traffic on the highways, streets, and alleys in the City of Marinette and the
State of Wisconsin.
B. Other State Laws Adopted
There are also hereby adopted by reference the following sections of the
Wisconsin Statutes, but the prosecution of such offenses under this Chapter
shall be as provided in Chapters 340 through 348 of the Wisconsin Statutes
and the penalty for violation thereof shall be limited to a forfeiture as
hereinafter provided in this Chapter:
23.33(2),
23.33(3)(a through h),
23.33(4)(a through e),
23.33(4c)(a)1,2,
23.33(4c)(a)3,
23.33(4p)(e),
23.33(6)(a through e),
23.33(7)(a), and
23.33(12)(b) All Terrain Vehicles
66.95 Unlocked Vehicles; Keys Left in Vehicle
110.075 Motor Vehicle Inspection
194.17(1) and (2) Common Carrier Violations
City of Marinette 2 Code of Ordinances
C. Statutes Specifically Incorporated by Reference
Whenever this Chapter incorporates by reference specific sections of the
Wisconsin Statutes, such references shall mean the Wisconsin Statutes of
1981-82 as from time to time amended, repealed, or modified by the
Wisconsin Legislature.
D. General References
General references in this Chapter to Wisconsin statutory sections or
chapters describing or defining procedures or authority for enactment or
enforcement of local traffic regulations shall be deemed to refer to the most
recent enactments of the Wisconsin Legislature describing or defining such
procedures or authorities.
E. State Traffic Deposit Schedule Adopted
The current uniform State Traffic Deposit Schedule periodically updates
and, provided by the Wisconsin Department of Justice to law enforcement
agencies and courts, establishes the amount of bond to be posted by those
persons cited for violations under this Chapter. The Uniform State Traffic
Deposit Schedule is hereby adopted as part of this Municipal Code, as the
official bond schedule for all traffic violations.
F. Nonmoving Violation and Registration Program
Pursuant to the provisions of Section 345.28(4) of the Wisconsin Statutes as
amended or superseded, the City of Marinette elects to participate in the
nonmoving traffic violation and registration program of the Wisconsin
Department of Transportation and pay costs established by the Department
under Wis. Stat. Sec. 85.13; such costs shall, in turn, be assessed against
persons charged with nonmoving traffic violations. The Marinette Police
Department shall be responsible for complying with the requirements set
forth in Wis. Stat. Sec. 345.28(4).
State Law Reference: Wis. Stat. § 345.28(4) (2003-2004)
(Ord. 2005-2046 adopted 11-1-05)
10.02 STATE ADMINISTRATIVE CODE PROVISIONS ADOPTED
A. Administrative Regulations Adopted
The following administrative rules and regulations adopted by the Secretary
of the Wisconsin Department of Transportation and published in the
Wisconsin Administrative Code, as amended, exclusive of any provisions
therein relating to the penalties to be streets imposed, are hereby adopted by
reference and made part of this Chapter as if fully set forth herein.
City of Marinette 3 Code of Ordinances
Wis. Adm. Code - MVD 3 Reciprocity - Nonresident Motor Carriers
[Penalties of Section 341.04, Wis. Stats., apply]
Wis. Adm. Code - MVD 4 Lettering on Vehicles, Display of Evidence of
Registration and Dual Permit
Wis. Adm. Code Trans 305 Standards for Motor Vehicle Equipment
Wis. Adm. Code - MVD 6 Transportation of Explosives by Motor Vehicle
Wis. Adm. Code - MVD 17 Transportation of School Children
Wis. Adm. Code - MVD 18 Protective Headgear Standards and
Specifications
Wis. Adm. Code - MVD 22 Standards and Specifications-Design and
Mounting SMV Emblem
B. Non-Compliance Prohibited
No person shall operate or allow to be operated on any highway, street, or
alley within the City a vehicle that is not in conformity with the
requirements of Subsection (a) or the provisions of Section 110.075 and
Chapter 347, Wis. Stats., incorporated by reference in Section 10.0101 of
this Chapter.
C. Owner's Liability
Any owner of a vehicle not equipped as required by this Section who
knowingly causes or permits such vehicle to be operated on a highway in
violation of this Section is guilty of the violation the same as if he or she
had operated the vehicle. The provisions of Section 347.04, Wis. Stats.,
relating to nonapplicability of demerit points, shall apply to owners
convicted of violation of this Section.
D. Safety Checks
1. Operators to Submit to Inspection
When directed to do so by any law enforcement officer, the operator
of any motor vehicle shall stop and submit such vehicle to an
inspection and such tests as are necessary to determine whether the
vehicle meets the requirements of this Section, or that the vehicle's
equipment is in proper adjustment or repair. No person, when
operating a motor vehicle, shall fail to stop and submit such vehicle to
inspection when directed to do so by any law enforcement officer as
herein provided.
2. Authority of Officer
Any law enforcement officer of the City is hereby empowered
whenever he or she shall have reason to believe that any provision of
this section is being violated to order the operator of the vehicle to
stop and to submit such vehicle to an inspection with respect to
brakes, lights, turn signals, steering, horns and warning devices, glass,
City of Marinette 4 Code of Ordinances
mirrors, exhaust systems, windshield wipers, tires, and other items of
equipment.
3. Vehicle to be Removed from Highway
Whenever, after inspection as provided by this Section, a law
enforcement officer determines that a vehicle is unsafe for operation,
he or she may order it removed from the highway and not operated;
except for purposes of removal and repair until the vehicle has been
repaired as directed in a repair order. Repair orders may be in the
form prescribed by the Secretary of the Department of Transportation
under Section 110.075(5), Wis. Stats., and shall require the vehicle
owner or operator to cause the repairs to be made and return evidence
of compliance with the repair order to the department of the issuing
officer within the time specified in the order.
E. Penalty
Penalty for violation of any provision of this Section including the
provisions of the Wisconsin Administration Code, incorporated herein by
reference, shall be as provided in Subsection (C) of this Section, together
with the costs of prosecution and applicable penalty assessment.
10.03 OFFICIAL TRAFFIC SIGNS AND CONTROL DEVICES; PROHIBITED
SIGNS, SIGNALS, AND MARKERS
A. Duty of Chief of Police and Department of Public Works to Erect and
Install Uniform Traffic Control Devices
Whenever traffic regulations created by this Chapter, including a State of
Wisconsin traffic regulation adopted by reference in Section 10.0101,
require the erection of traffic control devices for enforcement, the Chief of
Police and the Department of Public Works or their designee shall procure,
erect, and maintain uniform traffic control devices conforming to the
Uniform Traffic Control Device Manual promulgated by the Wisconsin
Department of Transportation, giving notice of such traffic regulation to the
users of the streets and highways on which such regulations apply.
Whenever State law grants discretion to local authorities in erecting or
placement of a uniform traffic control device, devices shall be erected in
such locations and in such a manner as in the judgment of the Chief of
Police and the Department of Public Works or their designee will carry out
the purposes of this Chapter and give adequate warning to users of the
streets and highways of the City of Marinette.
B. Code Numbers to be Affixed to Official Traffic Control Devices
The Chief of Police or the Department of Public Works or their designee
shall cause to be placed on each official traffic control sign, a guide board,
mile post, signal, or marker erected under Subsection (a) a code number
assigned by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation, and shall also
City of Marinette 5 Code of Ordinances
place or direct the placing of code numbers on all existing official traffic
control devices as required by the laws of the State of Wisconsin.
C. Prohibited Signs and Markers in Highways
No person, other than an officer authorized by this Chapter to erect and
maintain official traffic control devices or his or her designee, shall place
within the limits of any street or highway maintained by the City of
Marinette any sign, signal, marker, mark, or monument unless permission is
first obtained from the Public Works Department, or where applicable, the
State Highway Commission. Any sign, signal, marker, mark, or monument
placed or maintained in violation of this subsection shall be subject to
removal as provided in Subsection (D).
D. Removal of Unofficial Signs, Markers, Signals, and Traffic Control Devices
The Chief of Police, Department of Public Works, or their designee may
remove any sign, signal, marking, or other device which is placed,
maintained, or displayed in violation of this Chapter or State law. Any
charge imposed against premises for removal of a prohibited or illegal sign,
signal, marking, or device shall be reported by the Chief of Police or his
designee to the Common Council for review and certification at its next
regular meeting following the imposition of the charge. Any charge not paid
on or before the next succeeding November 15 shall be placed upon the tax
roll for collection as other special municipal taxes.
State Law Reference: Sections 346.41 and 349.09, Wis. Stats.
10.04 OPERATORS TO OBEY TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICES
Every operator of a vehicle approaching an intersection at which an Official
Traffic Control Device is erected in accordance with this Chapter shall obey the
direction of such Official Traffic Control Device as required by the Wisconsin
Statutes incorporated by reference in Section 10.0101 of this Chapter. Operators
of vehicles approaching a stop sign shall stop before entering a highway as
required by Section 346.46, Wis. Stats. Operators approaching intersections at
which a yield sign has been installed shall yield the right-of-way to other vehicles
as required by Section 346.18(6), Wis. Stats.
10.05 SPEED LIMITS
A. Street Speed Limits
The maximum speed limit on all City streets shall be twenty-five (25) miles
per hour except for:
1. Thirty-five (35) miles per hour on Interstate Bridge.
City of Marinette 6 Code of Ordinances
2. Thirty-five (35) miles per hour on Cleveland Avenue from Roosevelt
Road to a point one thousand three hundred twenty (1,320) feet West
of Pierce Avenue.
3. Fifteen (15) miles per hour on State Street from Riverside Avenue to
White Street.
4. Fifteen (15) miles per hour on State Street for the first one hundred
fifty (150) feet north of the northern most railroad track and the first
one hundred fifty (150) feet south of the southern most railroad track
at the multiple railroad track crossing north of the intersection of State
Street and Sherman Street and south of the intersection of State Street
and Spruce Street.
5. Fifteen (15) miles per hour commencing at a point on Lewis Street
two hundred feet (200') west of Josephine Street; thence westerly on
Lewis Street to the intersection of Madison Street and Lewis Street;
thence south on Madison Street one hundred fifty feet (150').
6. Fifteen (15) miles per hour commencing at a point on Woleske Road
three hundred fifty feet (350') east of Aerial Drive; thence easterly on
Woleske Road to a point one thousand one hundred feet (1,100') west
of Industrial Parkway south.
7. Fifteen (15) miles per hour on Cleveland Avenue within one hundred
fifty feet (150’) of its intersection with 6th Street when children are
present.
8. Twenty-five (25) miles per hour on the Old Peshtigo Rd. between
Cleveland Avenue and County Highway T.
9. Fifteen (15 miles per hour on the portion of Stanton Street adjacent to
the Tyco Safety Products Administration Building. (Ord. 2061
adopted 6-6-06)
10. Fifteen (15) miles per hour on Russell Street from Ogden Street to
Market Street when children are present. (Ordinance 2013-2262
adopted 9-9-13)

Russell and Leonard Streets, on Waldo Street between Russell and Hancock
Streets, on Carney Avenue between Armstrong and Madison Streets, on

children are present), on Daggett Street between Pierce Avenue and Colfax
Street, on any street, road, path, or other right-of-way lying east of Alimeda
Street and leading to Red Arrow Park, in any designated recreation area, in

In the interest of public safety and pursuant to authority granted by Wisconsin

10.0107 Repealed – Ordinance 2012-2219 adopted 2-7-12
10.0108 STOPPING, STANDING AND PARKING
A. Parking on Street
Unless otherwise authorized herein, no person shall park, stop, or leave
standing any vehicle, whether attended or unattended, upon any street
unless parallel to the edge of the street, headed in the direction of traffic, on
the side of the street, and with the curb-side wheels of the vehicle within
twelve (12) inches of the curb or edge of the street.
B. Stopping Prohibited in Specified Places
No operator of a vehicle shall stop, stand, or park such vehicle in any of the
following places, except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic
or to comply with the directions of a traffic officer or traffic control sign or
signal:
1. Within intersections of streets.
2. On a crosswalk.
3. On a sidewalk or sidewalk area except as provided in this Chapter.
4. Alongside or opposite any street excavation or obstruction when such
stopping, standing, or parking would obstruct traffic or when
pedestrian traffic would be required to travel in the roadway.
5. On the roadway side of any other parked vehicle unless such double
parking is clearly indicated by markers or official traffic signs.
C. Parking Prohibited in Specified Places
No operator of a vehicle shall park a vehicle in any of the following places
except to comply with the directions of a traffic officer or traffic control
signal or sign except that in any loading zone designated in Schedule B,
which is a part of this Section the operator of a truck or other delivery
vehicle may park such vehicle in the loading zone for not more than onehalf
(1/2) hour at any time while making a delivery or pickup:
City of Marinette 8 Code of Ordinances
1. In a loading zone. (See Schedule B for designated loading zones.)
2. In an alley in a business district.
3. Within fifteen (15) feet of a driveway entrance to a fire station or
direction across the street from such entrance.
4. Within ten (10) feet of a fire hydrant unless a greater distance is
indicated by an official traffic sign.
5. In front of a private driveway or alley.
6. Upon the near side of a street adjacent to a school during the hours of
7:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. during school days.
7. Upon any portion of a street when such portion is properly designated
by an official "no parking" sign erected pursuant to the authority and
direction of the Chief of Police, or the Public Works Department.
8. On a street adjacent to the entrance at a school, church, theater, hotel,
hospital or any other place of public assemblage during the hours
designated by an official sign.
9. Closer than two (2) feet to another vehicle when parking parallel to
the edge of the street.
10. Closer than fifteen (15) feet to the near limits of a crosswalk.
11. Where curb and gutter exists, no vehicle shall be parked upon a tree
lawn or public right-of-way alongside or adjacent to a highway,
roadway or street within the City of Marinette unless the property
owner has obtained a permit from the Civic Affairs, Cemetery, Traffic
& Lights Committee. Where curb and gutter exists during the time
period when the winter parking ban is in effect, upon request of the
property owner, the Civic Affairs, Cemetery, Traffic & Lights
Committee may authorize parking on a tree lawn or public right-ofway
if the property owner proves to the Committee: 1) that not
allowing the property owner to utilize tree lawn or public right-ofway
for parking would constitute a hardship: and 2) that allowing said
parking does not constitute a traffic hazard. For purposes of this
section, a tree lawn or public right-of-way shall include the area
between the property line and the (roadway) traveled portion of the
highway. These restrictions shall not apply if the pavement alongside
or adjacent to the property in question has no curb and gutter.
Property owners who receive a permit will maintain and restore the
tree lawn adjacent to their property after the winter parking ban
expires.
D. Vehicles on Street for Advertising Purposes
No person shall park any vehicle displayed for sale upon any street. No
person shall operate or park any vehicle for the primary purpose of
displaying advertising on any street.
City of Marinette 9 Code of Ordinances
E. Traffic Officer May Move Vehicles Parked on Street
Whenever any traffic officer shall find a vehicle standing upon a street in
violation of the provisions of this Chapter, he is authorized to move such
vehicle or to require the operator in charge thereof to move such vehicle to a
position permitted under this Chapter.
F. Disabled Vehicles on Street
The provisions of this section shall not apply to the operator of any vehicle
which is disabled while on the street in such a manner or to such extent that
it is impossible to avoid stopping or temporarily leaving such vehicle in
such position.
G. Parking or Stopping on Left Side of Street
No person shall park or stop a vehicle on the left side of the street, except
on one-way streets.
H. Trailers, Etc.
It shall be unlawful to park or leave standing upon a City street or alley any
propelled or non-propelled vehicles including motor homes, commercial
trucks, camper, snowmobile trailer, boat trailer, small mobile trailer, and
semitrailer for a continuous period of twenty-four (24) hours. As used
herein, "continuous" means for essentially the entire twenty-four (24) hour
period and brief movement or transfer to an adjacent location shall not
interrupt the twenty-four (24) hour period. (Cross-Reference: Section
10.0117)
I. Angle Parking
Anything to the contrary herein notwithstanding, angle parking will be
permitted on the following streets:
1. The southeast side of Liberty Street between Stephenson Street and Vine
Street;
2. The northwest side of Wisconsin Street between Stephenson Street and Vine
Street;
3. The northeast side of Vine Street between Liberty Street and Pierce Avenue;
4. The east side of Pierce Avenue between Wisconsin Street and Stephenson
Street.
5. The east side of Tenth Street from Carney Boulevard north to the first alley.
J. Street Storage Prohibited
No person owning or having custody of any partially dismantled,
nonoperable, wrecked, junked, or discarded motor vehicle shall allow such
vehicle to remain on any public highway, parking lot, or ramp longer than
seventy-two (72) hours after notification thereof by the Police Department.
Notification shall be accomplished by placing in a conspicuous place on the
City of Marinette 10 Code of Ordinances
vehicle and by mailing or serving upon the owner or occupant in charge of
the premises a written notice setting forth briefly the applicable provisions
of this Section and the date of the notice. Any vehicle so tagged which is
not removed within twenty-four (24) hours after notice is declared to be a
public nuisance and may be removed as provided in Section 10-1-39.
K. School Bus Double Parking
The double parking of school buses shall be allowed on Terrace Avenue
between Ninth Street and Water Street.
L. Ludington Street Parking
Parallel parking shall be allowed on both sides of Ludington Street between
Ely Street and Stanton Street off the paved surface and within unpaved road
Right-of-way. (Ordinance 2013-2260 adopted 9-3-13)
10.0109 PROHIBITING CAMPER AND R.V. PARKING AND THE OCCUPYING
OF ANY STOPPED OR PARKED MOTOR VEHICLE ON RIVERSIDE
AVENUE BETWEEN HATTIE STREET AND NORTH RAYMOND
STREET
A. Camper and R.V. Parking
No person shall park any mobile home, travel trailer, camper, motor home
or any other similar self-contained recreational vehicle on the north side of
Riverside Avenue between Hattie Street and North Raymond Street.
B. All Vehicles
No person may occupy any stopped or parked motor vehicle on the north
side of Riverside Avenue between Hattie Street and North Raymond Street.
10.0110 WINTER PARKING RESTRICTIONS
A. During the months of December, January, February, and March, no person
shall park a vehicle on the northeast side of Riverside Avenue, from the
driveway at the rear of the Stephenson Public Library to the railroad bridge.
B. When signs have been erected at or reasonably near the corporate limits as
provided in Sec. 349.13, Wis. Stats., no person shall park any vehicle on any
street in the City of Marinette between the hours of 1:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m.
during the months of December, January, February, and March.
C. Stopping temporarily for the purpose of receiving or discharging passengers
or loading or unloading is not prohibited by this Section providing the vehicle
is attended by a licensed operator.
D. This Section does not apply when:
1. The vehicle becomes disabled while on the highway in such a manner
or to such an extent that it is impossible to avoid stopping or
temporarily leaving the vehicle in the prohibited place; or
City of Marinette 11 Code of Ordinances
2. The stopping of the vehicle is necessary to avoid conflict with other
traffic or to comply with traffic regulations or the directions of a
traffic officer or traffic control sign or signal.
E. Official traffic signs indicating the parking restrictions of this section shall be
placed or erected at or reasonably near the corporate limits of the City on all
state and county trunk highways and connecting streets, informing motorists
that night parking regulations are in effect in the City of Marinette.
10.0111 NO PARKING ZONES
When signs are erected giving notice thereof, no person shall at any time park,
stand, or leave standing any vehicle on the streets and alleys designated in
Schedule C, which is made a part of this Section.
10.0112 PARKING PROHIBITED AT CERTAIN TIMES
When signs are erected giving notice thereof, no person shall park a vehicle on
the streets, days, and times designated in Schedule D.
10.0113 LIMITED PARKING
When signs are erected giving notice thereof no person shall park a vehicle for
longer than the time indicated on the streets designated in Schedule E, which is
made a part of this Section.
10.0114 PARKING RESERVED FOR VEHICLES OF DISABLED
A. When official traffic signs indicating such restriction have been erected, no
person shall park, stop, or leave standing any vehicle upon any portion of a
street, highway, or public or private parking facility reserved for vehicles
displaying special registration plates or identification cards or emblems issued
by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation or, for vehicles registered in
another jurisdiction, by such other jurisdiction designating the vehicle as one
used by a physically disabled person.
B. This Section shall be enforced by the issuance of a local non-moving parking
citation under Section 10.0142(B)(2), as amended, and shall carry a penalty
identical to the penalty for a violation of Wisconsin Statutes Section 346.505,
as amended. The standard deposit shall be established by the Uniform State
Traffic Deposit Schedule, as revised from time to time.
C. Except for the defenses established by Wisconsin Statutes Section
346.505(3)(e)(2), as amended, which are adopted by reference, it is no defense
to a violation of this Section that the owner was not in control of the vehicle at
the time of the violation.

specific location within the parking lot. The specific location
of the designated parking area shall be determined by the
Director of Public Works. The specific parking area shall be
divided so that one-half of the area is utilized on Monday,
Wednesday, Friday and Sunday and the remaining one-half is
utilized on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday.
6. No permit shall be issued for parking of business related
vehicles during non-business hours or for the storage of
vehicles.

10.0117 PARKING HEAVY VEHICLES IN RESIDENTIAL DISTRICTS
No semi-trailer, tractor-trailer, large truck, mobile home, or any other vehicle or
combination of vehicles other than motor buses weighing more than ten thousand
(10,000) pounds or more shall be parked on any City street in a residential area
other than a routed State Trunk Highway for longer than four (4) hours and in no
event shall any of the above block or in any way impair access to a driveway or
entrance to the property of another or be located on the tree lawn or property of
another without permission.
10.0118 PARKING IN DRIVEWAYS
No person shall park or leave standing any motor vehicle in any private driveway
without the permission of the owner or lessee of the property upon which such
driveway is located, whether or not such driveway is posted to limit or restrict
parking. No vehicle shall be parked on private property that is not otherwise open
for use by the public without the consent of the property owner. Forfeiture for this
violation shall be forty dollars ($40.00). Any forfeiture not paid within seventytwo
(72) hours shall automatically be increased to eighty ($80.00) dollars.
10.0119 ONE-WAY STREETS AND ALLEYS
The streets and alleys, or portions thereof, designated in Schedule F, which is
hereby made a part of this Section, are hereby designated one-way streets and
alleys and no person shall drive or operate a vehicle on any such street or alley, or
portion thereof, except in the direction designated.
10.0120 LEFT TURNS
When signs are erected giving notice thereof, no operator of a vehicle shall make
a left turn at any of the following intersections:
A. Traveling east from Dunlap Square, no left turn into Ludington Street.
B. Traveling west on Hall Avenue, no left turn into Vine Street or Dunlap
Avenue.
City of Marinette 15 Code of Ordinances
C. Traveling to Marinette from Menominee on Bridge Street at Dunlap
Square, no left turn on to Main Street except on the left turn arrow. A sign
reading left turn on arrow only shall be erected at said intersection.
D. Traveling northeasterly on Dunlap Avenue, no left turn onto Maple
Avenue.
E. Vehicles of a gross weight in excess of 16,000 pounds traveling
northeasterly on Marinette Avenue, no left turn onto Hall Avenue. Gross
weight shall be defined in Section 10.0124(B).
10.0121 RIGHT TURNS
A. Hall Avenue
Eastbound vehicular traffic on Hall Avenue intending to make a right turn
easterly on Main Street shall occupy the most easterly lane adjacent to the
curb in front of Lauerman Brothers Store facing Dunlap Square. Signs
shall be erected at appropriate places to effectuate the provisions of this
Section.
B. Vine Street
No person operating a vehicle on Vine Street shall make a right turn on to
Pierce Avenue, when appropriate sign is erected at such intersection.
C. Hall and Stephenson
All eastbound traffic traveling in the inner lane of Hall Avenue shall make
a right turn only on to Stephenson Street.
D. Vehicles of a gross weight in excess of 16,000 pounds traveling easterly
on Hall Avenue, no right turn onto Marinette Avenue. Gross weight shall
be defined in Section 10.0124(B).
E. Owena At Hall Avenue
Vehicles of a gross weight in excess of 8 tons traveling Northerly on
Owena Street, no right turn onto Hall Avenue. Gross weight shall be
defined in Section 10.0124(B).
F. Shore Drive
Right turns from Shore Drive onto any of the following streets must be
made from the inside lane: Cleveland Avenue; Forest Street; Prairie
Street; Edwin Street; Pine Beach Road; Florence Street; Edgewood Circle;
Cheri Boulevard and University Drive. (Ordinance 2010-2171 Adopted 4-
19-2010)

10.0125 SPEED RESTRICTIONS; SLOUGH BRIDGE
When signs are erected giving notice thereof, no person shall operate or cause or

10.0126 AUTHORIZED EMERGENCY VEHICLES
Pursuant to the provisions of Section 340.01(3)(g) of the Wisconsin Statutes, two
(2) motor vehicles of Emergency Rescue Squad, Inc., customarily used as
ambulances and known as emergency squad truck or ambulance and as standby
emergency squad truck or ambulance are designated as "Authorized Emergency
Vehicles."
10.0127 OBSTRUCTION OF RAILROAD CROSSINGS
No person shall leave standing or stop or permit or allow to stand or stop any
railroad train, engine, or car upon any street, alley, or highway crossing within the
City of Marinette so as to obstruct public travel for a greater period of time than
five (5) minutes without opening said street, alley, or crossing for at least five (5)
minutes. Any conductor, engineer, fireman, or brakeman on any train or
locomotive so obstructing any street, alley, or railroad crossing, or any yard
master, flagman, switchman, or section hand who shall allow and be responsible
for such obstruction shall be subject to the general penalty provisions of this
Code. The corporation running or operating such train, engine, or cars so
obstructing any street or railroad crossing shall be subject to a forfeiture of not
more than $200.
10.0128 TRAFFIC CONTROL ON HOSMER STREET
A. There is hereby established two (2) lanes for westbound vehicular traffic on
Hosmer Street; one (1) lane immediately to the right of the center line of
Hosmer Street and one (1) lane adjacent to the north curb.
B. The lane immediately to the right of the center line is reserved for through
traffic westbound on Hosmer Street, and all westbound through traffic using
the lane immediately to the right of the center line shall come to a complete
stop before proceeding into the intersection of Hosmer and Main Streets.
C. It shall be unlawful for the operator of any westbound vehicle to make a right
turn on to Main Street from the lane immediately to the right of the center line
of Hosmer Street.
City of Marinette 18 Code of Ordinances
D. The lane adjacent to the north curb of Hosmer Street as hereby established is
reserved for westbound traffic intending to proceed westerly on Main Street
and such traffic as is traveling in the lane adjacent to the north curb of Hosmer
Street may proceed to make a right turn on Main Street after coming to a stop
at the intersection of Main and Hosmer Streets.
E. Hosmer Street shall be appropriately marked to designate the two (2) lanes
hereby established on Hosmer Street for westbound traffic and signs shall be
erected designating in which lane right turns are forbidden and designating the
lane from which right turns are permitted.
F. A stop sign shall be erected at an appropriate place at the intersection of
Hosmer
G. Street and Main Street to control the stopping of through traffic using the lane
immediately to the right of the center line of Hosmer Street.

The west end of the alley between Hattie and Mill Streets shall be established as a

10.0131 PEDESTRIAN REGULATIONS
A. Pedestrian Obedience to Traffic Control Devices and Regulations
1. Obedience to Traffic Control Devices
No person shall fail to obey the instructions of any Uniform Traffic
Control Device when traveling as a pedestrian on any highway
within the City of Marinette unless otherwise directed by a law
enforcement officer.
2. Crossing at Crosswalks
No pedestrian shall cross at a crosswalk except on the right half
thereof whenever practicable. Where sidewalks are provided, no
pedestrian shall walk along and upon an adjacent roadway except
when the sidewalk is visibly unsafe, obstructed, or closed to public
travel.
B. Prohibited Pedestrian Crossings
1. Between Controlled Intersections
No pedestrian shall cross between adjacent intersections at which
Official Traffic Control Signals are in operation and crosswalks are
provided, unless such crossing is permitted by Official Traffic
Control Devices.
2. Pedestrians Crossing Main Street
It shall be unlawful for any pedestrian to walk across Main Street
from the intersection of Ludington Street and Main Street to the
south curb of Main Street at the middle entrance to the Lauerman
City of Marinette 20 Code of Ordinances
Brothers Store and it shall be unlawful for any pedestrian to walk
across Main Street from the south curb of Main Street at the
middle entrance of Lauerman Brothers Store northerly to the north
curb of Main Street where Ludington and Main Streets intersect.
Signs shall be erected at appropriate places to effectuate the
provisions of this Section.
10.0132 MOTORIZED VEHICLES PROHIBITED IN PARKS, RECREATION,
AND OTHER PUBLIC AREAS
No person may operate a motorized vehicle off of a designated street or parking
area in any City of Marinette park, playground, beach, recreation area, or any
other property owned by the City of Marinette. For purposes of this section, the
term "motorized vehicle" includes cars, trucks, motorcycles, motorbikes,
snowmobiles, all-terrain vehicles, and any other similar motorized conveyances.
10.0133 TAXICAB LOADING ZONE; EMERGENCY AND LAW
ENFORCEMENT VEHICLE PARKING ZONE
A. Taxicab Loading Zone
Specific areas within the City may be designated as loading zones for
taxicabs. The parking of any vehicle other than a licensed taxicab in a
taxicab loading zone is prohibited. Signage shall be placed adjacent to a
taxicab loading zone which shall state "Taxicab Stand - No Parking" and
the curbing adjacent to any taxicab loading zone shall be painted to
indicate a no parking zone. The following areas are hereby designated as
a taxicab loading zone:
The west side of Morgan Street from Hosmer Street northerly to the alley.
10.0134 COMPRESSION BRAKES PROHIBITED
A. Compression Brakes Prohibited
No person shall use motor vehicle brakes which are in any way activated
or operated by the compression of the engine of the motor vehicle.
B. Defense
It shall be an affirmative defense to prosecution under this ordinance that
compression brakes were applied in an emergency and were necessary for
the protection of persons or property.
C. Emergency Vehicles
Emergency vehicles shall be exempt from this ordinance.
City of Marinette 21 Code of Ordinances
10.0135 LEAVING KEYS IN VEHICLE PROHIBITED
No person shall permit any motor vehicle in his custody to stand or remain
unattended on any street, alley, or other public area, except an attended parking
area, unless either the starting lever, throttle, steering apparatus, gear shift or
ignition of the vehicle is locked and the key for such lock is removed from the
vehicle.
State Law Reference: Section 66.95, Wis. Stats.
10.0136 SCHOOL BUS WARNING LIGHTS
Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 346.48(2)(b)2., Wis. Stats., adopted by
reference in Section 10.0101 to the contrary, school bus operators shall use
flashing red warning lights in residential and business districts when pupils or
other authorized passengers are to be loaded or unloaded at locations at which
there are no crosswalk or traffic signals so that pupils must cross the street or
highway before being loaded or after being unloaded.
10.0137 OPERATION OF MOTOR VEHICLES IN PUBLIC PARKING LOTS AND
RAMPS
A. Unlicensed Operators Prohibited
No person who does not hold a valid operator's license shall operate a
vehicle in any public parking lot or ramp or in any private parking lot or
ramp held out for the use of parking for the general public.
B. Traffic Regulations Applicable
All provisions of Section 10.0101 of this Chapter and of the Wisconsin
Statutes and laws incorporated herein by reference shall be applicable on
any public parking lot or ramp and on any private parking lot or ramp held
out for use of the general public for parking or vehicular travel.
10.0138 IMPROPER CONDUCT WITH A MOTOR VEHICLE
A. Conduct Prohibited
No person shall, within the City limits of the City of Marinette, by or
through the use of a motor vehicle, including but not limited to an
automobile, truck, motorcycle, minibike, or snowmobile, cause or provoke
disorderly conduct with a motor vehicle, cause a disturbance or annoy one
(1) or more persons.
City of Marinette 22 Code of Ordinances
B. Definition
Disorderly conduct with a motor vehicle shall mean the engaging in
violent, abusive, unreasonably loud, or otherwise disorderly conduct,
including but not limited to unnecessary, deliberate, or intentional
spinning or wheels, squealing of tires, revving of engine, blowing the
horn, causing the engine to backfire, or causing the vehicle while
commencing to move or in motion to raise one (1) or more wheels off the
ground.
10.0139 REMOVAL OF ILLEGALLY PARKED VEHICLES
A. Hazard to Public Safety
Any vehicle parked, stopped or standing upon a highway in violation of
any of the provisions of this Chapter is declared to be a hazard to traffic
and public safety.
B. Removal by Operator
Such vehicle shall be removed by the operator in charge, upon request of
any traffic officer, to a position where parking is permitted or to a private
or public parking or storage premises.
C. Removal by Traffic Officer
Any traffic officer after issuing a citation for illegal parking, stopping, or
standing of an unattended vehicle in violation of this Chapter, is
authorized to remove such vehicle to a position where parking is
permitted.
D. Removal by Private Service
The officer may order a motor carrier holding a permit to perform vehicle
towing services, a licensed motor vehicle salvage dealer, or a licensed
motor vehicle dealer who performs vehicle towing services to remove and
store such vehicle in any public storage garage or rental parking grounds
or any facility of the person providing the towing services.
E. Towing and Storage Charges
In addition to other penalties provided in this Chapter, the owner or
operator of a vehicle so removed shall pay reasonable cost of moving,
towing, and storage. If the vehicle is towed or stored by a private motor
carrier, motor vehicle salvage dealer, or licensed motor vehicle dealer,
actual charges regularly paid for such services shall be paid. If the vehicle
is stored in a public storage garage or rental facility, customary charges for
such storage shall be paid. Upon payment, a receipt shall be issued to the
owner of the vehicle for the towing or storage charge.
City of Marinette 23 Code of Ordinances
10.0140 TEMPORARY CLOSING OF STREETS ADJACENT TO SCHOOLS
A. The Common Council may cause streets adjacent to schools that are not a part
of any Federal, State, or County Trunk Highway system to be set aside for the
safety of students during recreation activities for limited periods of time
during the school day.
B. The following steps must be followed:
1. Application by the entity proposing to close a street shall be made to
the City Engineer and shall include at a minimum the location, days
and times for the proposed street closing and the reasons therefore.
2. The Engineer shall prepare a report to the Civic Affairs, Cemetery,
Traffic and Lights Committee analyzing safety, traffic flow, and other
relevant aspects of the proposed street closing.
3. The Civic Affairs, Cemetery, Traffic and Lights Committee shall make
a recommendation to the Council.
4. The Council shall take action on the request.
C. The following shall apply to any such street closings:
1. School officials shall be responsible for erecting and maintaining
barriers or barricades.
2. The City shall not be liable for any damages caused by the street
closing and the school, School Board, and school district shall hold the
City harmless for any such damages.
3. Such street closing shall not interfere with or prevent local traffic from
using the street in questions.
4. No street may be closed for more than one and one-quarter (1-1/4)
hours at any one time, nor two (2) total hours in any given day.
10.0141 PENALTIES
A. Forfeiture Penalty
The penalty for violation of any provision of this Chapter shall be a forfeiture as
hereafter provided, together with court costs and fees prescribed by Sections
814.63(1) and (2) or 814.65(1), Wis. Stats., the penalty assessment for moving
traffic violations and the driver improvement surcharge imposed by Section
165.87 and 346.655, Wis. Stats., where applicable. Payment of the judgment and
applicable court costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges may be suspended by
the sentencing court for not more than sixty (60) days. Any person eighteen (18)
years of age or older who shall fail to pay the amount of the forfeiture, court
costs, any penalty assessment, or driver surcharge or other penalty imposed for
violation of any provision of this Chapter may, upon order of the court entering
judgment therefor and having jurisdiction of the case, be imprisoned until such
forfeiture, costs, and assessment are paid, but not exceeding ninety (90) days.
City of Marinette 24 Code of Ordinances
B. Other Sanctions
By Court. Nothing herein shall preclude or affect the power of the
sentencing court to exercise additional authorities granted by the
Wisconsin Statutes to suspend or revoke the operating privileges of the
defendant, order the defendant to submit to assessment and rehabilitation
programs or to attend traffic safety school in addition to payment of a
monetary penalty or in lieu of imprisonment.
C. Forfeitures for Violation of Moving Traffic Regulations
Forfeitures for violations of any moving traffic regulation set forth in the
Wisconsin Statutes adopted by reference in Section 10.0101 shall conform
to the forfeiture penalty permitted to be imposed for violations of the
comparable Wisconsin Statute, including any variations or increases for
subsequent offenses; provided, however, that this subsection shall not be
construed to permit prosecution under this Chapter for any offense
described in Chapters 341 to 348, Wis. Stats. for which an imprisonment
penalty or fine may be imposed upon the defendant.
D. Forfeitures for Parking Violations
1. Forfeitures for Uniform Statewide Parking, Stopping, and Standing
Offenses
Minimum and maximum forfeitures for violation of non-moving traffic
violations adopted by reference in Section 10.0101 as described in
Chapters 341 to 348, Wis. Stats., shall be as provided for the comparable
state non-moving traffic violation.
2. Overtime Parking
The forfeiture for violations of the provisions of Sections 10.0115 and
10.0116 of this Chapter relating to limited time parking shall be processed
through the Traffic Bureau and shall be forty dollars ($40.00) per offense.
Any forfeiture not paid within seventy-two (72) hours shall automatically
be increased to eighty dollars ($80.00).
3. Penalty for Other Parking Violations
The penalty for all other parking violations not included under Subsection
(1) above shall be a forfeiture of not less than forty dollars ($40.00). Any
forfeiture not paid within seventy-two hours shall automatically be
increased to eighty dollars ($80.00).
4. Penalty for violations of MMC 10.0118. The penalty for violations of this
ordinance shall be forty dollars ($40.00). Any forfeiture not paid within
seventy-two (72) hours shall automatically increase to eighty dollars
($80.00).
City of Marinette 25 Code of Ordinances
E. Other Violations
Any person who shall violate any provision of this Chapter for which a
penalty is not otherwise established by this Section shall be subject to a
forfeiture of not less than forty dollars ($40.00). Any forfeiture not paid
within Seventy-two (72) hours shall automatically be increased to eighty
dollars ($80.00).
F. Overtime Parking Exception; Jury Duty
1. During jury duty, ten (10) minutes before jury duty starts for the day, and ten
(10) minutes after jury duty ends for the day.
2. The vehicle is otherwise legally parked in an area limiting parking to thirty
(30) minutes or more.
3. The vehicle is used for transportation to and from jury duty.
10.0142 ENFORCEMENT
A. Applicable Court Procedures
Except where otherwise specifically provided by the laws of the State of
Wisconsin or the provisions of this Municipal Code, the traffic regulations in this
Chapter shall be enforced in the Municipal Court of the City of Marinette in
accordance with the provisions of Chapters 345 and 800, Wis. Stats. Citations.
B. Citations
1. Uniform Citation and Complaint
The Wisconsin Uniform Traffic Citation and Complaint described and
defined in the Wisconsin Statutes shall be used for enforcement of all
provisions of this Chapter except those provisions which describe or define
non-moving traffic violations and violations of Sections 346.71 through
346.73, Wis. Stats. Violations of Sections 346.71 through 346.73, Wis.
Stats., shall be reported to the District Attorney and the Wisconsin Uniform
Traffic Citation shall not be used in such cases except upon written request
of the District Attorney.
2. Parking Citations
The Chief of Police shall recommend a citation for use in enforcing the
non-moving traffic offenses in this Chapter. When approved by the
Common Council, such citation shall be used for enforcement of nonmoving
traffic regulations created or adopted by this Chapter, including
violations of non-moving traffic regulations defined and described in the
Wisconsin Statutes, adopted by reference in Section 10.0101, and all other
provisions regarding non-moving traffic violations in this Chapter. The
citation for non-moving traffic violations shall contain a notice that the
person cited may discharge the forfeiture for violation of a non-moving
City of Marinette 26 Code of Ordinances
traffic regulation and penalty thereof by complying with Subsection (C)(2)
of this Section. Non-moving traffic citations may be issued by law
enforcement officers or by civilian employees of the Police Department.
C. Deposits and Stipulations
1. Moving Traffic Offenses
(a) Who May Make. Persons arrested or cited for violation of
moving traffic offenses created by this Chapter shall be
permitted to make deposits and stipulations of no contest or
released by the arresting officer in accordance with the
applicable provisions of the Wisconsin Statutes. Stipulations of
guilt or no contest may be made by persons arrested for
violations of this Chapter in accordance with Section 66.12(1)(b)
of the Wisconsin Statutes whenever the provisions of Section
345.27 of the Wisconsin Statutes are inapplicable to such
violations. Stipulations shall conform to the form contained on
the uniform traffic citation and complaint under Section 345.11
of the Wisconsin Statutes and shall be accepted until the date of
return or the date of the scheduled appearance. Stipulations may
be accepted by the Clerk of Municipal Court and by the City
Police Department.
(b) Delivery or Mailing of Deposit and Stipulation. Any person
stipulating guilt or no contest under the preceding Subsection
must make the deposit required under Section 345.26 of the
Wisconsin Statutes or, if the deposit is not established under
such Statute, shall deposit a forfeited penalty as provided in the
schedule established by the Chief of Police and approved by the
Common Council. Deposits may be brought or mailed within
five (5) days of the issuance of the citation in lieu of court
appearance to the office of the Police Department or Clerk of
Municipal Court as directed by the arresting officer.
(c) Receipt Required. Every officer accepting a stipulation under the
provisions of this Chapter shall comply with the provisions of
Sections 343.27, 343.28, 345.26(1)(a) and 345.27(2) of the
Wisconsin Statutes and shall require the alleged violator to sign
a statement of notice in substantially the form contained on the
uniform traffic citation and complaint promulgated under
Section 345.11 of the Wisconsin Statutes. The official or person
receiving the deposit shall furnish and deliver or mail an original
receipt for such deposit to the alleged violator and shall deliver
the deposit and stipulation, and a copy of the receipt to the Clerk
of Municipal Court.
City of Marinette 27 Code of Ordinances
2. Non-moving Traffic Offenses
(a) Direct Payment of Penalty Permitted. Persons cited (summons not
issued) for violation of non-moving traffic offenses described and
defined in this Chapter may discharge the penalty thereof and
avoid court prosecution by mailing or forwarding within five (5)
days of the issuance of the citation to the City Treasurer the
minimum penalty specified for the violation. If not so forwarded,
the penalty may be discharged by forwarding within fifteen (15)
days of the date of the citation to the above named office the
amount of specified in Section 10.0141(D)(2) When payment is
made as provided in this paragraph, no court costs shall be
charged.
(b) Court Prosecution. If the alleged violator does not deliver or mail a
deposit as provided in Subsection a. and does not appear in court
for the initial appearance, a warrant shall be issued for his arrest.
(c) Registration Suspension Program. The City of Marinette shall
participate in the Traffic Violation and Registration Program
established under Sections 85.13 and 345.28, Wis. Stats., and Wis.
Adm. Code TRANS - 128. If the alleged violator does not pay the
forfeiture or appear in court in response to the citation for a nonmoving
traffic violation on the date specified in the citation, or, if
no date is specified on the citation, within twenty-eight (28) days
after the citation is issued, the City may ask the Wisconsin
Department of Transportation to suspend the registration of the
vehicle involved or refuse registration of any vehicle owned by the
person pursuant to the provisions of Sec. 345.28(4), Wis. Stats.,
which is hereby adopted by reference.
(d) Parking Violation Deposits Returned to City Treasurer. Officers
receiving deposits for non-moving traffic violations under this
Subsection shall pay over such deposits to the City Treasurer.
(e) Bond. Any officer accepting deposits or forfeited penalties under
the ordinance shall deliver them to the City Treasurer within
fifteen (15) days of the first of the following month. Any officer
authorized to accept deposits under Sec. 345.26, Wis. Stats., or
this Chapter shall qualify by taking the oath prescribed by Sec.
19.01, Wis. Stats., and filing an official bond as required.
10.0143 TRAFFIC BUREAU
A. Traffic Bureau Established
There is hereby established a Traffic Bureau in the City of Marinette under
the jurisdiction of the Chief of Police. The Traffic Bureau shall have the
authority to receive the forfeitures enumerated in this Chapter. The
forfeitures are to be collected by the Chief of Police and deposited in the
City of Marinette 28 Code of Ordinances
general fund. The Chief of Police is to delegate a police officer to assist
him in charge of the Traffic Bureau. The Chief of Police shall make all
necessary rules and regulations to operate the Traffic Bureau in an
efficient manner.
B. Citation for Violation
Any officer observing a violation of the parking provisions of this Chapter
shall serve upon the violator a written notice to appear at the Traffic
Bureau of the City of Marinette in the City Hall at any time within fortyeight
(48) hours of the service of the notice and pay to the officer in
charge of the Traffic Bureau the forfeiture required by this section.
C. Form of Notice
Such notice shall be made out on a triplicate form and shall indicate the
duration of time of parking; the hour, date and place of violation; motor
and license plate numbers; name of violator and owner.
D. Copies of Notice
The officer serving the written notice provided for in this section shall
deliver one (1) copy of the notice to the violator, or affix the copy in a
conspicuous place on or within the vehicle, one (1) copy to the officer in
charge of the Traffic Bureau, and one (1) copy to the City Treasurer.
E. Duty of the Comptroller
The triplicate notice from herein before referred to shall be identified by a
separate serial number for or each notice. The Comptroller shall audit all
accounts, records, files, and papers of the Traffic Bureau at stated periods.
The Police Chief shall furnish to the Council monthly reports of the
number of violations, warrants, appeals, cancellations, and receipts.
10.0144 VEHICLES TRANSPORTING SALT
A. Any motor vehicle, and any trailer pulled by a motor vehicle, transporting
salt upon any highway, street, or alley shall have its salt cargo securely
covered and any loose salt removed from the exterior of the truck and trailer
sufficient to prevent the escape of any salt.
B. Authorized municipal vehicles used for the spreading of salt shall be
exempt from this ordinance.
10.0145 SCHOOL CROSSING GUARDS
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 349.215, as amended, adult school
crossing guards may be appointed for the protection of persons who are crossing
any street or highway in the vicinity of a school. The school crossing guards shall
wear insignia or uniforms which designate them as school crossing guards and
shall be equipped with signals or signs to direct traffic to stop at school crossings.
City of Marinette 29 Code of Ordinances
10.0146 UNAUTHORIZED PARKING IN RESTRICTED PARKING LOTS
A. Owners or lessees of public or private property may permit parking by
certain persons and limit, restrict, or prohibit parking as to other persons if
the owner or lessee posts a sign on the property indicating for whom
parking is permitted, limited, restricted, or prohibited. No person may leave
or park any motor vehicle on public or private property contrary to a sign
posted thereon.
C. This section shall be enforced by the issuance of a local non-moving
parking citation under Section 10.0142(B)(2), as amended, and shall carry
a penalty identical to the penalty for a violation of Wisconsin Statutes
Section 346.55(4), as amended, and as established by the Uniform State
Traffic Deposit Schedule, as revised from time to time.
10.0147 CLOSING NINTH STREET BETWEEN TERRACE AVENUE AND MAIN
STREET DURING THE TIMES THAT SCHOOL BUSES ARE LOADING
AND UNLOADING PASSENGERS
Ninth Street between Terrace Avenue and Main Street shall be closed to vehicular
traffic during the times that school buses are loading or unloading passengers.
10.0148 NO PASSING IN RIGHT LANE ON SHORE DRIVE BETWEEN
UNIVERSITY DRIVE AND CLEVELAND AVENUE
No motor vehicle operator in the right lane may pass another motor vehicle
traveling in the same direction on Shore Drive between University Drive and
Cleveland Avenue.
10.0149 NO U-TURNS FOR WESTBOUND TRAFFIC ON WATER ST.
APPROACHING ITS INTERSECTION WITH TERRACE AVENUE
In addition to any other statute or ordinance, no westbound operator of a motor
vehicle on Water St. between Ninth St. and vacated Terrace Ave. may make a UTurn
and proceed easterly on Water St.
10.0150 NO PASSING ON WEST BAYSHORE STREET BETWEEN THE
INTERSECTIONS OF OGDEN STREET AND EDWIN STREET
City of Marinette 30 Code of Ordinances
10.0151 NO U-TURNS ALLOWED

Hall Avenue and Hattie Street
Hall Avenue and Ludington Street
Hall Avenue and Main Street
Hall Avenue and Riverside Avenue
Hall Avenue and State Street
Hall Avenue and Stephenson Street
US Hwy. 41 and Carney Avenue
